title: Mark Your Calendars for Bike Camp in Chattanooga, Tennessee!
content:
Bike Camp is a two day bike festival in Chattanooga, Tennessee on April 12th and 13th, put on by Two Bikes Chattanooga, that celebrates the noncompetitive side of cycling. Grab your friends, pack your bags, and head to Bike Camp. Two Bikes will be setting up its tents beneath Lookout Mountain in one of the most beautiful areas in the Southeast, Reflection Riding…

Once you’re unpacked, Saturday will be filled to the brim with activities. Bring your parts bin for the Parts Swap, your best bike for the Blue Ribbon Bike Show, your curiosity for the workshops, and end the day with a presentation from the ultra-endurance cyclist, Lael Wilcox. After coffee on Sunday Bike Camp will be hosting a variety of multi-surface rides showing off some of the best kept secrets in the region!

All proceeds from Bike Camp go to Two Bikes Chattanooga. Two Bikes takes donated bikes and transforms them into practical transportation for underserved community members in the greater Chattanooga area. Learn more about Two Bikes at www.twobikeschattanooga.com

Workshops with Best Friends
Each of these workshops is an expression of the region and community in Chattanooga, Tennessee. A close friend leads each topic in town, and Two Bikes is proud to highlight the diversity of talents in the area.

Appalachian Woodworking
Local chair maker, Tyler Rogers (he/him), will be leading this workshop where participants will have the opportunity to learn about green woodworking (working with wood that is not kiln dried), chairmaking, and hand-tool woodworking.

The South’s Finest Parts Swap
Do you have a bin full of arguably-rare vintage bike components? Japanese handlebars? Purple anodized Topline Cranksets? The Parts Swap is for you! Purchase a table (or share one with your friend) and buy-sell-trade your little heart out.

Good Vandalism
A workshop about making change in your community without waiting for approval. Jon Jon (he/him) will guide you through creative, low-cost ways to improve public spaces, from tactical urbanism to small-scale interventions that make a difference, build community, and invites others to greater awareness and involvement.

Native Plant Identification
Sometimes you gotta learn from the best. Lynne Welden (they/them) will be leading a plant identification workshop focusing on native plants in the Southeastern Appalachian Bioregion.

Perfect Pour Over
A workshop that’s just as good for home as it is for bike camping. The Velo Coffee Bar Manager, Abel Zhun (they/he/she), will be teaching you how to make the perfect pour-over with camping equipment plus their favorite at-home setup.

A Presentation from Lael Wilcox
Lael Wilcox is an ultra-endurance bicycle racer and cycling advocate who won the Trans Am Bike Race in 2016, set the Tour Divide women’s course record in 2015, and was the first American to win the Trans Am.
Lael is the keynote speaker for Bike Camp 2025 and will be giving a presentation on Saturday night and leading a community group ride in on Sunday.

Your Dream Group Rides
Each of our curated group rides is designed to show off some of the most beautiful areas of the Southeast. There will be the perfect ride for you, whether you’re just getting into riding bikes or are an experienced cyclist.

Rides include the Advance Mountain Bike Ride, showing off some of the best singletrack of the Southeast. The Sleephead Chilleur ride which explores local mixed surface trails, beautiful views, and scenic destinations. The FTW-NB ride that will explore some of the most fun trails on Lookout Mountain, and Lael’s Big Group Ride which will conclude the festival!

The Blue Ribbon Bike Show
The Blue Ribbon Bike Show is the new version of the regionally famous Met Gala Alt Bike Show. This year, there are three trophies: Modern (post-Y2K), Classic (Pre-Y2K), and Alt-Bike.

Do you have the perfectly beausaged Rivendell? A perfect resto-mod GT? One of those Stridsland 26”+ jammers with the Danish-artisanal-hand-drilled rear dynamo light? Boy, do we have an opportunity for you! Bike Camp is excited to announce that it will be partnering with us over here at The Radavist to feature the winners of Blue Ribbon Bike Show on their site. Lisan al Gaib!

We recognize that everyone can’t just drop $120 to go to a bike festival

That’s why Two Bikes has launched its Bike Camp Scholarships program. We’re offering 32 – tickets to community members completely for free.

Applying is easy. Send a DM to @twobikeschattanooga in text or video format that explains why you are a good candidate for the Bike Camp Scholarship. Our event committee will make decisions on applications on a rolling-basis, so apply early!

 

Get your tickets at Two Bikes Chatanooga!
